It's a small place with white tablecloths and candles and some sort of bas relief on the back wall.  Classy hipsters, this is a good bet if you prefer lounge rather than bar.  You can get beer here, but it really calls for cocktails and the bartenders make them well and will even do special orders if you're nice about it.  AND they let dogs in.
author: Dana F.

description: I used to like this place but I'm withholding most of its stars because of the bitchy bartender. I went there on a recent Friday and ordered a ginger ale for my brother and a Maker's Mark for my boyfriend. The bartender managed to fuck that up by mixing both drinks in one glass (I just want to know what kind of a dipshit thinks it's a good idea to ever mix Maker's Mark with ginger ale). When I told her that I had actually asked for two separate drinks, she gave me a lecture on how I ordered wrong. She then proceeded to pour my brother's ginger ale into a shot glass. When he gave her a dirty look, she took my boyfriend's glass of Maker's Mark and dumped out half of it. I wanted to deck her. But the best I can hope for is that she get fired when enough people realize what an asshole she is (by the way, my brother wants it to be noted that she had plumber's crack).
author: Pia S.

description: The lone palm is hilarious! ...but it would be cooler if all the old-ish creepy dudes had an all out fight 'til the death with all the ridiculously dressed old-ish hip girls. I'll drink to that!
author: katharine s.

description: I am surpised that I have not written a review of this place. I have been going to this bar for many years. It's a great date place. The bar can get really crowded. It's great when you can find a table to sit. It's a low key bar to meet your ex, bring a date or meet friends.
author: Jennifer S.

description: My fav mission bar because it regularly has the fewest ironic mission coolsters and bridge n' tunnelers (whatever, I know I'm from Oakland). Also, many people are in their thirties here. I like being among my brethren.
author: Ella c.

description: This is a a bit off the path, but a nice place to come with a small group of friends or someone special for an after-dinner drink. The candle-light gives the whole place a romantic glow.
author: Karsten P.

description: Late night on a saturday night, this is a great place to finish off with a few drinks. It's not too crowded, mostly a neighborhood bar of late 20 and 30somethings.
author: Phil M.

description: super cute place. its a dive but has a homey yet classy feel to it. it must be the white table cloths on the round tables. =P good mix of people. not too crowded. good music. good place to hit up for pre-dinner drinks or even a night cap.
author: Linda N.

description: Nice neighborhood dive to grab a quiet drink with friends.  It's a few blocks away from the better known watering holes in the Mission, so it stays relatively uncrowded.
author: Andrew E.

description: Love the Lone Palm.  It's small, but not too crowded, sort of a throw-back-to-the-40's ambiance, yet with a hip underlay.  Not LA hip, and not overtly hip, but understated.  I'm all about lighting, so I always appreciate a bar with candles.  It's all that a bar should be.
author: Laurel B.

description: I really wanted to like this place but for some reason or another I just couldn't do it. It's almost art deco (which is a style I love) but it kind of gets thrown off with parts of the decor that just don't fit. The tablecloths are in my humble opinion a bit pointless unless you've covered the other bases to bring it all together. Maybe it's a pet peeve or growing up with minimal cathode ray intervention but I hate TV's in bars, unless it's a sports bar anfd you're there to watch sports. It really doesn't fit with the noir, fedora, white tablecloth scene at all. I'll agree it's a good place for an affair and it's a grown up bar, maybe too grown up for a lost boy like me.
author: Artimus I.

description: I'll give you the one star back if you take out the wall sconce at the far end of the bar.  You know the one, the one that's like dressing room lighting in a dark bar, the one bright wall sconce that sorta ruins all sorts of below-the-belt groping that should happen at the far end of dark bars.
author: Jen I.

description:
great noir, seen-but-not-to-be-scene type of place....
decent drinks, although the last time i was there....yikes, i really hate to say it, but i'm pretty sure my grey goose martini was hampered down a bit.  it won't stop me from returning, but i will have to make note of this the next time i go.
has the essentials - seats, music, good mix of people and good nut and cracker mix.  best time - friday after work, but before it gets crowded.

i love how you can check your lipstick while sitting in the women's stall of the restroom....for some reason it has a slightly naughty, campy appeal.
author: Jackie C.

description: Nice chill spot to have a drink with friends.  Don't know what else to say about it, but I'd definitely go here again.
author: Chris Q.

description: Just went in to the Lone Palm on Christmas Eve Day (If that's not a day to drink, I don't know what is).  The bartender, Jill, was super friendly and made me an awesome Mojito.  Great service, very chill atmosphere and it's right in my neighborhood. I think I've found a new local watering hole!
author: Dave D.

description: How have I not reviewed Lone Palm yet?  Dear lord I love this place.  Great service, black & white movies on the tv, often a couple of dogs running around on weeknights.  Chill crowd.  Awesome awesome.  Gets really, really crowded on the weekends, but then where in the Mission doesn't?  Oh that's right, the Liberties, because it's not a good bar.
author: Sarah B.

description: the cheesy neon sign threw me off at first but lone palm has quickly become one of my favorite destinations in the mission.  a good chill spot to go to with friends (lots of tables/chairs for lounging) or with a date (candlelit coziness) and best of all an endless supply of free goldfish crackers.  score.
author: Jane L.

description: I really liked this bar. Really, really liked it. It sort of felt like I was in the middle of a movie I didn't understand, but the drinks were good and the bathroom was so unexpectedly lovely I just stood there for a second. I like this bar.
author: Arwen O.

description: The lone palm is my favorite bar spot yet. No, it's not a dive bar so I guess I am going against my natural instincts but.. I love this place so much it has me wearing vintage hats again. It is classy, sexy, dark candlelit and makes me feel like I am Katherine Hepburn. The wine is good. The bartenders are excellent. The old movies playing on the one little tv in the place make me nostalgic for a time when people dressed classy and were swept away by love. maybe my prince charming will find me here if I'm lucky. I am all yours Lone Palm.
author: Eryn L.

description: This is a cool place but I went here on a Saturday night.  It was really crowded and hard to even move.  Luckily we grabbed a table so once we sat down it was nice.  I'd like to try coming back here during a weekday when it's not so crowded.
author: Mitch A.

description: Came here on a Tuesday night.  Eclectic and funky crowd - alot of them wearing hats and one chick with a clown purse. Inexpensive drinks - but made very weak.  I had 2 Belvedere Cape Cods and was barely buzzed.  Atmosphere was stylish with a little kitsch, good music - Blondie and some random hip tunes.  Bathrooms were clean.  Good place to hang and talk.
author: Audra E.

description:
If you walk in on a Friday night and see two females--one of which slightly resembles Lauren Conrad from, I think it is, "The Hills"--  working the bar, walk right back out. 

Last month, me and about 10 other girls went to The Lone Palm on a Friday night for a drink. We took turns staring at eachother in utter disbelief as these two snotty chicks ignored us and carried on with their conversation. They did not, would not even take a drink order!

Marianna is the bartender to see here. She's tall, brunette, very pretty, and very attentive and sweet. If you see her, have a seat!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Lone Palm is one of those random bars where anything might happen at any moment and most of it good. All that and it's low-key, too. I had an epiphany at this place one night after a Kentucky Derby party in the Mission and under the influence of Old Rip Van Winkle bourbon (it's the best and that Derby party is something else too).
author: Jim G.

description: For the bartender that played the excellent head game w/that Curran B guy down there somewheres!
author: Anne Marie M.

description: I liked this place. The other reviews said this place was really classy but I wasn't really feeling it. The tables had white table cloths on them and there weren't any bar fights breaking out but I've been to nicer places. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice place and it looks like it is a dive bar from the outside but then you go in and it's a nice clean bar but I wouldn't say it was super classy. I mean, yes, I classed the place up a bit by just showing up for a drink there but it didn't scream classy.  Ok, I was joking about me classing the place up. It was definitely a late 20's early 30 something crowd which was cool and the beer was cheap. I would definitely go back to this place next time I'm in the area.
author: Jaclyn P.

description: I used to like this place until they fired the best bartender they ever had - Cy.  A real cool cat - sophisticated deejay playing a wide variety of underground gems , showing cool videos, witty repartee, an all around great host, perfect gentleman.  Miss him dearly!  Does anyone know where he's bartending now???  I'm there!
author: jane d.

description: This is one of those rare bars in SF that feels just cool enough to be a place you want to show off to your friends and not cool enough to attract the people who ONLY eat/sleep/fuck/drink at the COOL places. If you like your bartenders smart, sweet, sassy, attractive  and able to pour a mean drink then you have found the right place. Weekend late nights bring in some Marina types and Mission hipsteristas, but in general the crowd is mixed and funky - gay, straight, artists, business types, older, younger.  You name it, the Lone Palm's got it. So if you are looking for a cool place to hang out but just aren't cool enough to BE COOL, come on in and pull up a bar stool.
author: Paul C.

description:
I just wrote a review tearing into the Latin American Club, so I figured I should balance it out with somewhere I have always been happy.

I've always had the same bartender, this beautiful and happy woman who pours the drinks deep.  She has always treated my friends well and is really just the best.  They have a good scotch selection and I just really like going there.
author: Dronic D.

description: Quirky and oddly done up inside.  Looks like a dive from outside, but actually isn't.  Had to update this - they're sort of a martini bar, both in style and in selection of alcohols, but the mixing has gone downhill lately.  The last few drinks have been poorly balanced and really just not very good.  Disappointing.
author: Don H.

description: Kina cool, a dignified adult lounge for young people in the noe/castro edge of the Mission.  As people point out this is a classy joint without any gimmick or over-the-top camp, circa 70s or 80s.  Nice liquor selection, packed tables but no food.  Sex ratio 50/50, nobody looking film noir beautiful but not sleazy skanky either.  I doubt many fights break out.  Hangar One martini was $7 and a decent-sized pour, half the price of the tonier bars.  Bartenders prompt, cordial, competent.  Very noisy but not too much for conversation.  Good place to meet friends, I would say.
author: Gil S.

description: Love this place!  Reminds me of home... a dark and mysterious little Art Deco night club nestled in Miami.  It's the only place where a palm tree really fits in this town!  All they need is a jazzy Cuban band playing and my fantasy would be complete.  The ideal spot for intimate convos and a little under-the-table foot rubbing ; )
author: Tara G.

description: To the bartender who cleared my drink even though it was 3/4 full when there were other empty glasses to be taken away from our table and then threw a crumpled up dollar bill at my friend: WHY? You could have just said "oops, I'm sorry. I didn't realize you were still drinking that." Instead, you gave us major attitude about wanting to finish a drink we had purchased. I know it's crazy to think that patrons at your establishment might actually want to finish an entire drink but were you really serious? Thanks to the other bartender for offering us free drinks to make up for this clown that, I'm hoping, was recently hired there. I won't be returning as long as said clown continues to be employed there.
author: Brian W.

description: #1 date bar in the Mission.  Do not bring a buddy here lest you seduce him.
author: Gabriel D.

description: A dive bar that doesn't smell of stale beer. I love it. In fact, I'd venture to say it's not so much a dive bar, than a ultra low-key lounge complete with white tablecloths and candles. It's perfect for an after-work drink when you want some ambiance without the scene.
author: a p.

description: Best bar ever.  Ever ever ever.  A Mission bar that isn't completely over-run with 20-something hipster wannabees or soul-less yuppie wankers. Amazing.  Thank you, Jesus.
author: D D.

description: Really don't get to visit Lone Palm enough, since it's not close to my place. But when I do, I always enjoy myself. Where else can you enjoy cheap beer and cocktails under the 'shade' of a fake palm tree? Usually not too loud or crowded. Love that they take credit cards. Great neighborhood bar. No major complaints. Highly recommended.
author: Gregory G.

description:
i'm amending my review AGAIN.  the more i go to lone palm, the more i LOVE it.  the room often has a very cozy aroma of bourbon....

AND the dude who may have charged me for the water actually sent me an apology over yelp (the wonders of yelp!).  now, that's truly dedicated service.  will definitely be back to sip a fine hendricks & tonic soon...
author: sunny d.

description: A neat place to take a friend or a date for drink...  You can hold a conversation here since the music isn't annoyingly loud... The white tablecloth covered tables, candles, and neon lights set the dark yet sophisticated ambiance...
author: Matt B.

description: Right across the street from my apartment.  It's part the decor, it's part the bartenders, and a lot of the other lone palmers that get to go walk across the street for a drink every now-and-then.  If dive bars could have a touch of class, this is how they'd be.
author: Jay S.

description: It's seems like the kinda place where married men go to meet up with their mistresses.   Dim, kinda quiet, subdued, with small tables and candles.  I liked it better when they allowed you to smoke.  Not a place for the loud n'  rowdy.
author: Karen F.

description: A great place to sip grapefruit and gin and channel your inner Philip Marlowe. Keep your back to the wall, your hat brim low, and watch out for dames on the make.
author: Brian M.

description: Wow.  The kind of place i would never go to unless someone knew about it.  Verdict ~ seems like a good date place because it's rather intimate.  music was good at times and okay at times.  laid back crowd.  (they need fish tanks on their walls to compliment their tropical theme)...  thus, if i am here with you and you are a girl, then yes, we are on a date, unless you are married.  then we are having an affair.
author: Scott Y.

description: Another great dive bar for a Friday night. Good, fun vibe with a mix of a lot of different people. Can get a little crowded after about 10:00p, so if you can snag a table - do it. My only complaint would be the cigarette smoke trailing in from the outside, continuously - yech. But what can I say? Its a bar, I'm not a smoker, so I accept that this is just part of the deal. Definitely would hang out here again.
author: Leen K.

description: Hard to park, but it is a product of its environment. Anyway, if you are drinking Manhattans, you should not be driving. Excellent local hangout with friendly and knowledgeable bar staff. AND they actually have a lone palm tree out front. Not a meat market and the music is just the right volume - loud enough to mask awkward pauses and inappropriate stories (but not too loud to tell them). Their Manhattan was crisp and exciting from the young indie tender with the messy blonde hair.
author: Gwenyth K.

description: Lone Palm. Quality free matches, decent drinks, flattering candle light, and bartenders that don't act like you should be kissing their ass in order for you to beg for a drink. Right down the street from some of my other favorite places too.
author: Candice L.

description: I liked the chill atmosphere and not-so-inflated prices.  However, the management reeeeeaally might want to rethink the white tablecloth-plus-votive thing -- maybe it was just me, the klutz, but I could not move away from our table without fearing that I'd burn the place down.  Or maybe I've just been studying for the bar and I see potential torts everywhere!
author: Nat K.

description: Kind of stinky...  I don't know what that smell was, but it drove me out of there pretty quick.
author: Mason G.

description: I don't know why I get David Lee Roth's "I'm Just a Gigolo" stuck in my head when I come to the Lone Palm. Go figure.
author: Brandon B.

description: Love this bar for the retro Miami Vice neon lights, the perfect size half bottles of Moet, sweet bartender, a lone palm tree in the front and a total lack of conformity to whats trendy today.
author: polina S.

description: Perhaps the best noir bar in SF. Go here for an intimate talk, or a small gathering of maximum 4 people. It's pretty small. Best on a weekday night. The bartenders are good at more than making drinks: once, in response to my inquiry about the music she was playing (The Real Tuesday Weld - also very noir) the bartender actually lent me the CD for a week! Dang!  Also nice: little bowls of nuts/ pretzels. And white tablesloths. Un-sceney.
author: Olivia S.

description: A little stiff, but a place you can meet friends and actually chat it up. I would avoid this place on the weekends it is too busy, thus taking away from the one reason I go there. To be able to sit and chat.
author: Erin O.

description: Recently met friends here for a couple drinks and really liked the vibe. Its dark, has palms and is a fun bar!
author: Inome C.

description: So yea, I live in Ingleside. However, I claim this as my neighborhood bar. Hands down my favorite place in the City. Everything in that place is classy without being pretentious. The fucking urinal in the mens room! Oh my, the full length thing is great. B&W movies being played way over there on the tiny screen. Tablecloths and candles. I mean come on. And the drinks are delicious. There's a Magic 8Ball floating around there somewhere, and no I don't mean with the hipsters in the bathroom. Can I rent a room right above here please?
author: Matt L.

description:
*4/19/08 Update:*  Bumping up a star 'cause the bartender was friendly and super-efficient the last time I went.  Big improvement.
-------------------------------------------------
Great bar with nice lighting, music, and clientele, but oy, the bartender the last 2 times I've been...  Unfortunately, in going for "sassy" we instead get "bitchy".  Even with no other customers, it can take 10-15 minutes to get a drink because she's too preoccupied with performing her one-woman show for the guys at the end of the bar.   (For a good description of this phenomenon, see here: http://www.yelp.com/biz/lone-palm-san-francisco#hrid:4QoVI05X-mYw5093rb2l3A .)

Such a shame because the bar and environment are wonderful.  Why is she allowed to act this way?
author: Zeke A.

description: Lone palm indeed, blue lit, good drinks and a slightly gruff hipster crowd, the kind of place I always imagine people go when they are having an affair.
author: Stellah D.

description: Lone Palm is one of my favorite bars in the city.   The dim candlelit setting makes it a great place for a romantic first date.  Gets a little crowded during the weekends, but during the weekdays it's good spot to mellow out with friends.  Lawrence makes the best lemon drops ever!
author: Melissa S.

description: This seems like a pretty cool place. I am not a hipster so I can't be called aging. RUDE! Clean lines, simple and very casual. The drinks are very good. You have to ask for the Large. The bartenders are friendly, but everybody is in California. I don't fit in. A good mix of people and dress. Just about anyone can feel good coming here. I like the fact that packed here means you'll have less than a foot between you.
author: Steven M.

description: I spent the best New Year's Eve of my life here and it's mostly a blur.  For this, I am giving it 5 stars.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
driving through the mission, we thought we might not be able to find this place, but luckily we saw what we were looking for: a single palm tree next to a neon sign. this place is exactly what I picture an old lounge to be like. not the crazy slick uber-hip lounges they are building these days, but more down to earth, with white tablecloth covered tables to sit at. this seems like the kind of place where someone in the corner would be playing a piano, and you'd find it in some old movie... or maybe in Reno. it looks like the kind of place that must have been really nice a few decades back, but now is just a relaxed bar with a chill crowd. there are very few tables here, so on a busy night it's probably just about impossible to find a place to sit. there's also an... errr... interesting statue on the wall.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description: Unpretentious bar with a mixed crowd. I feel so young here. Not a bad spot to sit down for a couple drinks and chat. Gets really crowded around the bar area, but what do you expect of the weekends anyway?
author: Zell C.

description: Looks great from the outside and from the inside.  Drinks are a good price and the bartenders are usually easy on the eyes.  I lived near here and should have gone more.  It's a perfect neighborhood bar.  Even if you're not from the neighborhood.
author: Corey V.

description: A kickass neighboorhood bar, sadly not in my neighborhood.  Nothing special, which is awesome.  If that last sentence hit a chord with you, then you know what I mean, and you'll be visiting soon.  This is not dancing with the B&T crowd at Blondies, and this is not 5 gallons of green at Jade.    This is hanging out with your friends in a place where the floors aren't sticky and the tables have clothes.  Clothes, as in plural cloth, not clothings.
author: K M.

description: I like the extra large glasses for the draft beer and the bartenders were swamped but still friendly. The music was pretty great, surprisingly, as it started out with some 80s and then spanned everything in the years after...
author: Nicolas H.

description: You won't be alone here. You can get good drinks and it's cozy inside.
author: Constance C.

description: This bar is everything that is wrong with LA in SF...believe it or not! Overpriced wine and it took the waitress 20 minutes to get my order, she ignored me so hard that I ended up leaving after just an hour there (and I only stayed that long because I was meeting up with a visiting friend).  It was pretty crowded though...for some odd ass reason. It's cozy but I just don't dig how they've arranged the tables and chairs, when it gets crowded it's really not that comfortable or cozy. Neat bathroom though. I avoid this place like the plague that it is!
author: Gina R.

description: I'm a big fan. The atmosphere is close to perfect -- the only (circumstantial) downside is that it was packed when we arrived and there was no comfortable standing-up area, so we had to wait a tedious while to get seats. Once you've managed to claim a table, however, it's an assured good time: it's a nice step up from the grungy dive-bar scene in the Mission, but still comfortable and casual; it has a cozy and intimate vibe (despite being a fairly large locale); the tables are mantled and candle-lit; and the crowd is varied and vibrant. Good drinks, good music, and good company make a Saturday night at Lone Palm ideal.
author: G. J.

description: Fun dive bar. Always an eclectic crowd. Love stopping here for a post-dinner drink on our walk home.
author: Lee S.

description: Small tables, strong drinks, dim lighting. It's impossible to revert to San Francisco cliques when your chair is rubbing against your neighbor.
author: Samantha W.

description: Free goldfish!  Ok that's not the only thing going for this not really mission feel within the mission place.  But it's a highlight.  The decor is eclectic and fun.  My martinis were strong...and under $10.
author: Jolsna J.

description: The Lone Palm qualifies as another of my favorite bars in SF.  You can actually have a converstation here.  it has a very 40's feel to it...dark, mysterious, and sophisticated. love the movies they play on the tv;the music is always good; the candlelight enhances the noir feel, and the drinks are incredibly strong.  swanky matches are a plus as is the location .
author: sarah C.

description: I have been here twice and I am still undecided. It's not a place to meet people as much as it is to come and hang in your own group. I think the seating leads to that kind of experience. It's actually not a bad place for a date although I wouldn't go that far out of my way to take a date there cause it's far from my house. So go there to get a few drinks with friends but don't expect to meet a whole lot of folks. What does that translate to? It's a good neighborhood bar and that's about it. Much more fun places to go en la Mission.
author: Steve H.

description: Lovely place; I went here last night with a friend and it was better than I expected. The bar tender was very nice and attentive; the music was enjoyable and not too loud. Well, the volume did get loud for a second but she was on top of it and turned it down immediately. The bathroom even has scented lotion; you have got to love that. I would recommend this place to anyone that likes to relax with friends or a date. I plan on going again with both :)
author: E P.

description: I love how the outside looks like it was once a swank club in the middle of Miami during the 1980's.  I have an equal affinity for the feel and candle lighting of the inside.  The prices aren't bad either with most drinks ringing up at about $4-$4.50.  As mentioned before it is a great place to meet up with friends and even better if you're trying to merge two groups of friends.  My only legitimate gripe is a dearth of creativity when it comes to the draft beer selection as they tend to feature most of the usual suspects but I guess I can always be happy with guiness and sierra nevada.
author: Steven R.

description: My favorite local watering hole, clean but still divey and out of the way. Always friendly service and only once in a while is it too crowded. My only complaint is that they need a jukebox...
author: Adrienne G.

description: I wish this place would get better air circulation inside.   I mean I know I am a fat guy who warms up better than most, but this place is ridiculous.  I've had to leave twice because it is too stuffy.
author: Floyd F.

description: My favorite dive with a vibe. Great place to meet up before trolling the Mission for din-din on a Friday night. Love the goldfish cheezoid snacks with a cosmo. The bartender makes great cocktails, but since there's usually only one there when I go, it takes a while to be served - hence no 5 stars. Great music and seemingly frequented by nice people. It's a dive that cleans up nicely. You kinda wonder why the floors aren't sticky.
author: Deb C.

description: Lone Palm is a great change from the typical SF bar experience.  It has the atmosphere of a Cuban jazz club, with its paintings of palm trees and small round tables covered with white tablecloths.  The amazing thing about it is that it has all of the good qualities of a dive bar (cool patrons, reasonable prices, good music, never too packed), but it has a lot of the charm and pizazz that a dive bar might be missing.  Great place to end a night out if you live in the area.
author: Mr. G.

description: My favorite place to drink.  I was introduced to Lone Palm during the same time as my stint w/Eagle's.  This was when there was smoking in the Lone Palm.  I love introducing people to this place as a dear friend did for me.  The barkeeps are beautiful, there is candlelight, the girls love the tobacco rose goods in the bathroom (I don't but to each) and the regulars are cozy.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Good beer selection, friendly bartenders, full liquor selection. Think 50's nightclub. If your local and over the  valencia cordor I'll see ya there.
author: t h.

description: This is my favorite bar in the city, hands down.  Kind of a cross between a romantic date night supper club and a neighborhood good vibe place.  Both of our last visits scored the group of two tables at the front between the large palm trees so the good karma keeps on coming.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: Eh it could be cheaper but their is something about this bar that is so beach town dive trying to class it up that makes the Lone Palm a winner. I remember one night I was headed there and my roomie at the time said "Really, that always seemed like a bar to go to if you were having an affair." She said no, but she is right, it's got that awesome sleazy vibe, I am sure they don't want that advertised but it has to do with the table cloths and neon in the bar and the art deco style building and lone palm tree out in front that I just find really charming in that sad Santa Cruz sort of way.
author: Gabe L.

description: Almost TOO swanky, if that's possible. A great place to bring out-of-towners. Above average martinis.
author: Andrew L.

description: I actually heard of this bar by reading reviews on Yelp!  I thought it sounded like a fun place and I gave it a try.  I like it.  It's a good place to go for a drink after work.  It wasn't packed but there were enough people there to give it a good atmosphere.  The bartender was nice.  I also liked their selection of music.  When I got there they were playing some old-time jazz and blues.  Eventually, they switched it to more modern music.  I'll definitely go back to Lone Palm.
author: Sara H.

description: A little casablanca meets cocktail meets the south pacific.  this bar has an understated sophistication yet casual atmosphere, its cool, its chill and you will come back.  weekends after 9pm are crazy, standing room mostly or you circle the tables like a hawk until someone leaves..we all know that "look" from those standing when you actually have a table, thou shall not covet!
author: erica u.

description:
so you're going on a date and you need a bar that looks nice, is in a good neighborhood, has nice drinks and snacks, AND you dont want to run into anyone you know? this is the place!

gets a little crowded later on but its good for early get-to-know-you cocktails. my perfect date spot!
author: Jaei P.

description: A local neighborhood bar with white tableclothes, candles, a full bar, great music and always a good crowd.  Sometimes there are bowls of nuts, which I don't eat cause that's gross.  Bathrooms are clean and they have rose water spray, ladies.
author: Mission D.

description:
The problem with this place is threefold.

1st:  overpriced drinks
2nd:   this is a straight bar, yet almost all of the patrons are guys.
3rd:  this bar has no doorman and there tends to be fights outside about once a month, sometimes with inanimate objects.

I just updated this bar from 1 to 3 stars cause the fights seem to have stopped.

But now the beer lines taste soapy so all of the beers on tap taste off  ;(
author: Henry C.

description: One of my favorite places in the city to get a drink. Great, chill atmosphere, wonderful martinis and other mixed drinks. Rarely horribly crowded, which is a huge plus given the rest of the Mission spots. Awesome for weekday nights. Also had a blast on New Year's eve with a bunch of friends and some very cute chicks flashing their boobs.
author: Liboo K.

description: Great local bar with great, mostly female, bartenders that pour strong drinks and play great music. The only TV in the place is playing old, classic movies with no sound. Nice white tablecloths and free snakes add to the ambiance of this fine dive bar. Excellent place for after work cocktails.
author: Joe c.

description: This is one of my favorite local spots. Love the deco stylings...it's a great place to drink with a friend, take a date, or just chill out by yourself and watch one of the cool movies they have playin' on the tv. They serve up some decent martinis here as well.
author: Dave V.

description: i've been wanting to go to this place for awhile now, and finally got the chance recently!  i don't know why, i guess the name "lone palm" says it all, but i felt like i was in L.A. or miami (thought i've never been to miami.)  all i had was a beer, so i can't vouch for the drinks, but i liked the little candlelit tables and the bird mix type stuff in the bowls.
author: Kate W.

description: i'd been wanting to check this place out for a while, you know, cause of the name and all.  its really just a low-key dimly lit dive bar that goes that one step further and places little candles and white linen tablecloths over the scattering of tables in the bar. its no big deal, really. i did appreciate the assortment of different types of people who were gathered round the bar and i got a fairly nice glass of pinot grigio for $7. i got to check out some asscracks since my friend and i were the only ones actually seated at a white linened table with a great view of various butts. also i was apparently glowing due to the lighting system they had set up. nothing like looking like a mystical goddess while checking out cracks. word.
author: Karen K.

description: i always feel very david lynch blue velvet in here.  is this just me?  i really like this place and the bartenders are all very nice and just a little bit creepy.  in a good way.  i always get champagne with a chambord floater for some reason.  makes me feel sassy!
author: Laura B.

description: I left my little safe zone to visit lone palm for a buddies bday party. she was seeking a 'dive bar' and we had some divey ones on the list to choose from. Lone star could be discribed as a dive of sorts, but id think of it more of a hole in the wall. It's smallish and has lots, lots of seating. more like restaurant style seating. there are goods and bads to that. it was great because i had my sexy shoes on which meant we drove to the party (not walked or dealt with wandering) so when i saw tthere were chairs that was a plus. All the seating though can be bad because the place gets pretty full and theres absolutely 0 room to dance if the mood strikes. Funky decor and cheap drinks make it  a worth while stop. For me, i've gotmy significant other for life, but if i were still a single gal Id probably have gotten bored here as its not really a hot place to meet people - or it didn't seem to be. Probably wont return since its outta my neck-a-the-woods but it wasnt bad.
author: Audrey V.

description: went here with a friend from finland last year. she got really drunk and loved it. i thought it was ok. maybe because it was a quiet night there, or maybe i was just in a bad mood... who knows. i might go back on a busier night to see if i like it better. small and dark is fine, but the crowd is usually what keeps me coming back.
author: Michelle I.

description: i went here on tuesday during happy hour. it was pretty mellow; they had good music playing and free snacks! a big plus since i had skipped lunch that day.  the bartender with the australian(?) accent was really sweet and funny, a rare thing to find at a mission bar.  anyway, i got a kick out of the 80's miami vice feel of the place. i'd say my only complaint is that the drink prices are a little high, other than that it was nice and i will definitely go back!
author: Erin H.

description: Dive bar with some deco style and limited attitude.  Great spot.
author: Will C.

description: decor is nice its off the beaten path of the mission which is nice but both times i have been here the bartenders have been super rude to not only myself but other people around me trying to order drinks. i won't go back.
author: victoria h.

description: the lone palm's exterior is a physical manifestation of the old cliche that you shouldn't judge a book by its cover.  the lone palm combines diviness with cleanliness and a solid menu to satisfy a wide spectrum of thirst.  i always choose lone palm...and they have good snacks too.  goldfish, mixed nuts, or asian crackers served in tasteful goblets.  lastly, they almost always play good music.
author: Sandra T.

description: i have been reading all of the posts on this bar and it is making me angry. Did someone actually complain about the smokers outside? You transplants should of seen this neighborhood 10, 20 years ago! and you claim to love SF,,,, Oh yeah, and bartenders are not hired to flirt with you or be your best friend. Saying they are not overly nice as a complaint is totally weird. Go to a strip club or find a friend on Craigs List. Until then drink your drinks and if you like the way they taste tip. PS. The bartenders were very very nice to me, not that thats why i go to a bar.
author: shannon k.

description: I'm kind of surprised this place averages out at four stars.  It's a decent enough bar, but to be frank, it's pretty low on character and just feels like a typical bar.  You can't really argue with that, but you're not exactly going to write home about it either, now are you?
author: Patrick P.

description: I love going into a bar and having a major sense of deja vu. When I first moved here I was unemployed and a tad downtrodden, so a lot of my memories of bars and restaurants come with a bittersweet tinge to them. I walked in here a few weeks ago and visions of my first couple months here washed over me, it was incredible I had put this great little tavern in the back of my mind for so long. The music isn't too loud which is fantastic for chatting, there always seems to be room for a little boozing with you and your friends and the atmosphere is dark and cozy. To top it all off, we were out with some friends I hadn't seen in awhile and they let me know that they were getting engaged. Engaged! Holy shit, that calls for some champagne. Who delivered on that perfect toasting opportunity? Oh yeah, the Lone Palm. The champagne was probably 10 years old and had to be dusted off, but hey, we were all lit up already anyway and happy with the bubbly. And the best news is my friends are moving right down the street, so I'll have to suggest this place for beers waaay more often. Lone Palm? I've left you alone way too long, please welcome me back...
author: Michael E.

description: do NOT, i repeat...do NOT get overly excited when you go to the restroom...ladies....and find that the establishment has kindly provided you with hand lotion to lather up with after you wash your hands.  i gingerly walked back to the table and told my friends how cool the place was because there was lotion in the bathroom...little did i know that the smell of the lotion would blossom into an overpowering, headache inducing fragrance!  so, all in all, the bar is a cool hang...but beware of the lotion....consider yourself warned!
author: Tabatha Y.

description: i had a fun time at this place.  the crowd was super friendly and everyone was easy to talk to.  it was a bit small so i was kind of uncomfortable but after some drinks i hardly noticed.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Great place for drinks -- bit of a Cuban feel.
author: Kent L.

description: very subdued place. good vibes here. a nice place to meet with a friend or a mistress and have a quiet conversation. no rowdy punks to be found. plenty of mirrors inside to see how much better u look as the night progresses. i recommend the black russian. creamy, dreamy with a touch of cialis.
author: ray c.

description: this place has got a great retro feel to it.  on the small side, but a great place to catch up / hang out with a buddy.
author: shaun l.

description: it's dark, it's nondescript. don't ask me why but lone palm weirds me out...
author: heather m.

description: Tiny bar off of Guerrero. Cute, packed, and drinks aren't too expensive. It seems like a chill place. A good mix of people.
author: Jovi C.

description: the mission bar that's not crawling with annoying hipsters. good pours on the drinks, good vibe.
author: dannebrog ..

description: my guy friends tell me this is the place you take your date when you want to seal the deal. they say it never fails. i've only been here with friends, but i can see that they are probably right.
author: Adrienne Y.

description: reminds me of what old hollywood would be like if i knew what old hollywood was actually like. the room was filled with cloth covered tables to sit down at and there was not a lot of standing around a drinking unless you are at the bar. while it felt more restaurant like because of this, it worked. i felt like i wanted to put on a starlet dress and smoke long cigarettes at the bar (but that could have just been me).  good 'middle ground' place to hang out with friends who are into different scenes.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: My favorite bar to go to on an odd weekday night.  Sometimes I feel like I'm in that painting 'nighthhawks'.  The bartenders are really nice, but sometimes they really fuck up the drinks.  Order the basics and you will be ok.
author: Cody R.

description: this is the only mission bar i will step into on a friday or saturday night. this place has a real comfy feel and the bar tenders are attentive. no bad tude here.
author: City G.

description: best dirty vodka martinis ever! this is a change from your average mission bar with a decor almost reminiscent of new jersey jewish house circa 1992ish.  additionally, there is a strange sculpture on the wall with a boob hanging over a mirror.
author: celiac j.

description: Lively crowd when you're looking for some nightlife and hanging out with  Nikki the hot bartender with brains to match when things are slow.  What's not to love?
author: S. B.

description: This used to be a swanky place with great drinks and an unpretentious atmosphere.  The decor is still fabulous and the clientele is still good but the bartenders have gone downhill.  The last time I went in, we ordered absinthe ($15 drinks) and neither of the bartenders knew how to make it.  One of them kept asking us question about the drinks construction.  The drinks turned out terrible-I've had absinthe at least 20 times and this was not how its done.  When we confronted her about the tragic nature of the drinks, instead of trying to make things right, the bartender copped serious attitude with us which continued throughout our  stay.
author: pauline e.

description:
really wanted to check out this place since there r lotsa good reviews here on yelp. i like cool unpretentious neighborhood bars so finally went there with a friend last Thursday night. 

it was all good until we tried ordering drinks. the bar wasn't very busy but it took a good 15 mins or more before the 2 bartenders finally took our orders. they were too busy drinking shots amongst themselves and dancing around. it is great that people seem to enjoy their work and nothing wrong with having alittle fun while working but do not give the customers attitude and make them wait forever for their drinks while meantime you the bartenders already had a few of  your own!
i bartend too and know sometimes how difficult customers could be...would normally not write a nasty review but the experience was so bad that we left the bar mad and pretty disgusted by the bartenders working that night! 
it really was a shame as the bar itself is pretty cool... but in short we felt that the whole time we were there ... most of the time was spent waiting for our drinks... watching the bartenders drink shots after shots .... while giving attitude to people ... 

my friend wanted to order another drink as the cocktails he ordered was terrible! he was trying to make another order but trying to get attention from bartenders who are both busy dinking  and dancing around is no easy task so i told him to forget about it and we left ..thank god !
author: angsana o.
